channel.title: Posts on Nhan's everything
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Nhan's everything

item.title: Poly(trisulfides) a new polymer
item.description:
Our recent work in @ChemRxiv proposed a new electrochemical polymerization way to synthesize poly(trisulfides) with precise control of sulfur rank. DFT calculations revealed that precise sulfur rank was ensured by a reversible ‚Äòself-correcting‚Äô mechanism. https://t.co/G92GfYx78i pic.twitter.com/Rwv40H3QBj

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) March 28, 2023

item.title: Python codes to prepare REST MD inputs
item.description:
Couples of months ago, I wrote ~400 lines of python codes to prepare inputs for replica exchange with solute tempering (REST) simulations using Gromacs. The code will save your time significantly. Now it is set public; feel free to check it.https://t.co/tMk5GTiLYv

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) November 12, 2022

item.title: New paper published in ACS Inorganic Chemistry
item.description:
I am very happy to have contributed to this work on a series of monometallic, homobimetallic, and heterobimetallic complexes of Cu and Zn. üòÅhttps://t.co/jciduBLn0P

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) November 21, 2022

item.title: ACS AMI highlights our work
item.description:
Molecular simulations by @LeNhanChem and Tiff Walsh @DeakinIfm identify design rules for bioconjugation using functional polymer coatings on upconversion nanoparticles. Thanks to @AFOSR for support!https://t.co/6AtyOkmhtk pic.twitter.com/Tte1lJM0gY

— ACS Applied Materials & Interfaces (@ACS_AMI) June 30, 2022

item.title: UCNP Paper is online
item.description:
Our paper on surface modification of upconversion nanoparticle is online. The theoretical protocol here can be used to design ligands and polymers on UCNP surface. Check github for force field parameters and UCNP structure. ü•Ç https://t.co/ztjNuOggEh

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) June 24, 2022

item.title: Upconversion nanoparticle coating
item.description:
AcceptedüòÅ. Not a huge paper, but this is the first ever theoretical work designed for polymer coating on upconversion nanoparticles. I'll talk more about this paper when it is online. pic.twitter.com/eJway1jHIg

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) June 15, 2022

item.title: ChemSciPicks paper is online
item.description:
This week‚Äôs #ChemSciPicks from Tiffany Walsh and Le Nhan Pham @LeNhanPham1 at @DeakinIfm looks at predicting biomolecule adsorption on MoS2 nanosheets with high structural fidelity (work supported by @AFOSR) üéâ

You can read it here, for free: https://t.co/yy7pybZ5I5 pic.twitter.com/F2h9maRjZ3

— Chemical Science (@ChemicalScience) April 13, 2022

item.title: MoSu-CHARMM Force Field
item.description:
Here we introduce data used for development of MoSu-CHARMM and notices for usage of MoSu-CHARMM
Data used for fitting MoSu-CHARMM force field

This depository (Github) contains all crystal structure files (CIF) of several optimized adsorption configurations used to calculate fitting and validation datasets of energy which were employed to fit and validate the MoSu-CHARMM. All adsorption energies in these two data sets can be found in the spreadsheet (Excel file).

item.title: Chem Sci Pick of the Week
item.description:
I'm thrilled to announce that my @ChemicalScience paper coauthored by Prof. Tiffany Walsh at @DeakinIfm has been selected as Chem Sci Pick of the Week. It will be published in a special collection soon. Stay tuned!
üçª pic.twitter.com/Jqg4xZ0FWT

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) March 18, 2022

item.title: MoSu-CHARMM force field in Chemical Science
item.description:
Very excited to share my recently accepted manuscript in @ChemicalScience. A new high-fidelity force field for MD description of interaction between 2D MoS2 and organic materials including peptides and proteins.https://t.co/sR8Lqzcxhi

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) March 16, 2022

item.title: Chemical communiation paper
item.description:
Our recently accepted paper in @ChemCommun proposes a novel criterion and then a new protocol for assessment and development of interfacial force fields. Very excited to share it here.

https://t.co/9OD4VZeXQO

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanChem) March 1, 2021
